alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 2:16AM MDT until May 29 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Yampa River near Maybell affecting Moffat County. .Warm temperatures will continue melt snowpack and lead to elevated river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Yampa River near Maybell. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the Yampa River reaches bankfull in spots which would result in minor flooding of low-lying agricultural land and some bank erosion. At 11.0 feet, the boat ramp in the Maybell Bridge Campground/Yampa River Access Point becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM MDT Sunday, May 28 the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate near bankfull conditions through Monday morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Yampa River Maybell 12.0 9.8 Thu 12 pm MD 9.3 9.2 9.3 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
